1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Exit process.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.System.Exit
6  ( exit, exitCode,
7    putSuccess, putSuccessLn,
8    putAbort, putAbortWith,
9    putFailure, putFailureLn,
10  ) where
11
12import qualified System.Environment            as Sys
13import qualified System.Exit                   as Exit
14import qualified System.IO                     as IO
15
16-- | Exit process.
17exit :: Int -> IO a
18exit = Exit.exitWith . exitCode
19
20-- | Map integer value to exit code.
21exitCode :: Int -> Exit.ExitCode
22exitCode 0 = Exit.ExitSuccess
23exitCode n = Exit.ExitFailure n
24
25-- | Print message and exit on 0.
26putSuccess :: String -> IO a
27putSuccess msg = success $ putStr msg
28
29-- | Print message line and exit on 0.
30putSuccessLn :: String -> IO a
31putSuccessLn msg = success $ putStrLn msg
32
33-- | Print abort message and exit on 1.
34--
35--   >>> putAbort
36--   ABORT / <interactive> exits on 1
37--
38putAbort :: IO a
39putAbort =
40    do prog <- Sys.getProgName
41       putFailureLn $ "ABORT / " ++ prog ++ " exits on 1"
42
43-- | Print error and abort message and exit on 1.
44putAbortWith :: String -> IO a
45putAbortWith msg =
46    do IO.hPutStrLn IO.stderr msg
47       putAbort
48
49-- | Print error message and exit on 1.
50putFailure :: String -> IO a
51putFailure msg = failure $ IO.hPutStr IO.stderr msg
52
53-- | Print error message line and exit on 1.
54putFailureLn :: String -> IO a
55putFailureLn msg = failure $ IO.hPutStrLn IO.stderr msg
56
57success :: IO () -> IO a
58success body = body >> exit 0
59
60failure :: IO () -> IO a
61failure body = body >> exit 1
62
